Dear friend, please dont take this personal, as its not my intention to discourage you in any way, but i think you deserve some words of truth.
Just by reading your description I can say that you know very little of what you are doing.
First of all MKV is not the format, its the container.
Second of all why the hell did you used High@4.0 together with 3 ref frames. You are not aware how many problemms people have with wrong set levels.
Third of all with AAC audio the best choice is MP4, for compatibility reasons.

And at the end dont be angry on people who just want some basics information.
Go google for more information, learn something and then come back to us with some new stuff :)

Well, actually after a session I thought that considering it's matroska, and DVDRip, the quality is below average, even for other formats.
I just discovered that movies are over 3 hours long, so taking that in consideration quality is 6-7/10 for the size.
